Navigating the AI Frontier: A Primer on the Evolution and Impact of AI Agents

An AI agent responds autonomously to inputs and its reading of its environment to make complex decisions and change the environment. An AI agent can be broadly defined as an entity that senses percepts using sensors and responds to its environment.

Key Concepts:

  • Autonomous decision-making
  • Environmental interaction
  • Goal-oriented behavior
  • Architecture of AI agents
  • Control centre in AI systems
  • Orchestration layer
  • User input and model processing
AI agent autonomy authority sensors effectors AI agents LLMs machine learning artificial intelligence
